lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Thanks, dear my lord.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: O, my offence is rank it smells to heaven;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: It hath the primal eldest curse upon't,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: A brother's murder. Pray can I not,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Though inclination be as sharp as will:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: My stronger guilt defeats my strong intent;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And, like a man to double business bound,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: I stand in pause where I shall first begin,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And both neglect. What if this cursed hand
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Were thicker than itself with brother's blood,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Is there not rain enough in the sweet heavens
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To wash it white as snow? Whereto serves mercy
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: But to confront the visage of offence?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And what's in prayer but this two-fold force,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To be forestalled ere we come to fall,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Or pardon'd being down? Then I'll look up;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: My fault is past. But, O, what form of prayer
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Can serve my turn? 'Forgive me my foul murder'?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That cannot be; since I am still possess'd
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Of those effects for which I did the murder,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: My crown, mine own ambition and my queen.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: May one be pardon'd and retain the offence?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: In the corrupted currents of this world
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Offence's gilded hand may shove by justice,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And oft 'tis seen the wicked prize itself
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Buys out the law: but 'tis not so above;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: There is no shuffling, there the action lies
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: In his true nature; and we ourselves compell'd,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Even to the teeth and forehead of our faults,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To give in evidence. What then? what rests?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Try what repentance can: what can it not?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Yet what can it when one can not repent?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: O wretched state! O bosom black as death!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: O limed soul, that, struggling to be free,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Art more engaged! Help, angels! Make assay!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Bow, stubborn knees; and, heart with strings of steel,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Be soft as sinews of the newborn babe!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: All may be well.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Your bedded hair, like life in excrements,
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Starts up, and stands on end. O gentle son,
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Upon the heat and flame of thy distemper
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Sprinkle cool patience. Whereon do you look?
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: On him, on him! Look you, how pale he glares!
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: His form and cause conjoin'd, preaching to stones,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Would make them capable. Do not look upon me;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Lest with this piteous action you convert
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: My stern effects: then what I have to do
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Will want true colour; tears perchance for blood.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: To whom do you speak this?
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Do you see nothing there?
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Nothing at all; yet all that is I see.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Nor did you nothing hear?
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: No, nothing but ourselves.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Why, look you there! look, how it steals away!
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: My father, in his habit as he lived!

lines.value: Look, where he goes, even now, out at the portal!
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: This the very coinage of your brain:
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: This bodiless creation ecstasy
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Is very cunning in.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Ecstasy!
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: My pulse, as yours, doth temperately keep time,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And makes as healthful music: it is not madness
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That I have utter'd: bring me to the test,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And I the matter will re-word; which madness
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Would gambol from. Mother, for love of grace,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Lay not that mattering unction to your soul,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That not your trespass, but my madness speaks:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: It will but skin and film the ulcerous place,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Whilst rank corruption, mining all within,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Infects unseen. Confess yourself to heaven;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Repent what's past; avoid what is to come;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And do not spread the compost on the weeds,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To make them ranker. Forgive me this my virtue;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: For in the fatness of these pursy times
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Virtue itself of vice must pardon beg,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Yea, curb and woo for leave to do him good.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: O Hamlet, thou hast cleft my heart in twain.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: O, throw away the worser part of it,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And live the purer with the other half.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Good night: but go not to mine uncle's bed;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Assume a virtue, if you have it not.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That monster, custom, who all sense doth eat,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Of habits devil, is angel yet in this,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That to the use of actions fair and good
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: He likewise gives a frock or livery,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That aptly is put on. Refrain to-night,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And that shall lend a kind of easiness
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To the next abstinence: the next more easy;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: For use almost can change the stamp of nature,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And either [         ] the devil, or throw him out
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: With wondrous potency. Once more, good night:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And when you are desirous to be bless'd,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I'll blessing beg of you. For this same lord,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I do repent: but heaven hath pleased it so,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To punish me with this and this with me,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That I must be their scourge and minister.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I will bestow him, and will answer well
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: The death I gave him. So, again, good night.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I must be cruel, only to be kind:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Thus bad begins and worse remains behind.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: One word more, good lady.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: What shall I do?
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Not this, by no means, that I bid you do:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Let the bloat king tempt you again to bed;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Pinch wanton on your cheek; call you his mouse;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And let him, for a pair of reechy kisses,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Or paddling in your neck with his damn'd fingers,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Make you to ravel all this matter out,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That I essentially am not in madness,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: But mad in craft. 'Twere good you let him know;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: For who, that's but a queen, fair, sober, wise,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Would from a paddock, from a bat, a gib,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Such dear concernings hide? who would do so?
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: No, in despite of sense and secrecy,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Unpeg the basket on the house's top.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Let the birds fly, and, like the famous ape,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To try conclusions, in the basket creep,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And break your own neck down.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Be thou assured, if words be made of breath,
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: And breath of life, I have no life to breathe
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: What thou hast said to me.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I must to England; you know that?
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Alack,
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: I had forgot: 'tis so concluded on.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: There's letters seal'd: and my two schoolfellows,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Whom I will trust as I will adders fang'd,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: They bear the mandate; they must sweep my way,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And marshal me to knavery. Let it work;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: For 'tis the sport to have the engineer
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Hoist with his own petard: and 't shall go hard
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: But I will delve one yard below their mines,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And blow them at the moon: O, 'tis most sweet,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: When in one line two crafts directly meet.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: This man shall set me packing:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I'll lug the guts into the neighbour room.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Mother, good night. Indeed this counsellor
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Is now most still, most secret and most grave,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Who was in life a foolish prating knave.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Come, sir, to draw toward an end with you.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Good night, mother.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: What, Gertrude? How does Hamlet?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Mad as the sea and wind, when both contend
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Which is the mightier: in his lawless fit,
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: The unseen good old man.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: O heavy deed!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: It had been so with us, had we been there:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: His liberty is full of threats to all;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To you yourself, to us, to every one.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Alas, how shall this bloody deed be answer'd?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: It will be laid to us, whose providence
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Should have kept short, restrain'd and out of haunt,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: This mad young man: but so much was our love,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: We would not understand what was most fit;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: But, like the owner of a foul disease,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To keep it from divulging, let it feed
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Even on the pith of Life. Where is he gone?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: QUEEN GERTRUDE
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: To draw apart the body he hath kill'd:
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: O'er whom his very madness, like some ore
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Among a mineral of metals base,
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: Shows itself pure; he weeps for what is done.
lines.speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: O Gertrude, come away!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Both countenance and excuse. Ho, Guildenstern!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And let them know, both what we mean to do,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And what's untimely done. O, come away!
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Since yet thy cicatrice looks raw and red
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: After the Danish sword, and thy free awe
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Pays homage to us--thou mayst not coldly set
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Our sovereign process; which imports at full,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: By letters congruing to that effect,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: The present death of Hamlet. Do it, England;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: For like the hectic in my blood he rages,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And thou must cure me: till I know 'tis done,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Howe'er my haps, my joys were ne'er begun.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Go, captain, from me greet the Danish king;
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Craves the conveyance of a promised march
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Over his kingdom. You know the rendezvous.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: If that his majesty would aught with us,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: We shall express our duty in his eye;
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: And let him know so.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: Truly to speak, and with no addition,

lines.value: That hath in it no profit but the name.

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Two thousand souls and twenty thousand ducats
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Will not debate the question of this straw:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That inward breaks, and shows no cause without
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Why the man dies. I humbly thank you, sir.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Captain
lines.speaker: Captain

lines.value: God be wi' you, sir.

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I'll be with you straight go a little before.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: How all occasions do inform against me,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And spur my dull revenge! What is a man,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: If his chief good and market of his time
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Sure, he that made us with such large discourse,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Looking before and after, gave us not
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That capability and god-like reason
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To fust in us unused. Now, whether it be
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Bestial oblivion, or some craven scruple
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Of thinking too precisely on the event,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: A thought which, quarter'd, hath but one part wisdom
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And ever three parts coward, I do not know
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Why yet I live to say 'This thing's to do;'
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Sith I have cause and will and strength and means
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To do't. Examples gross as earth exhort me:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Witness this army of such mass and charge
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Led by a delicate and tender prince,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Whose spirit with divine ambition puff'd
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Makes mouths at the invisible event,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Exposing what is mortal and unsure
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To all that fortune, death and danger dare,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Even for an egg-shell. Rightly to be great
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Is not to stir without great argument,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: But greatly to find quarrel in a straw
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: When honour's at the stake. How stand I then,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That have a father kill'd, a mother stain'd,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Excitements of my reason and my blood,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: And let all sleep? while, to my shame, I see
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: The imminent death of twenty thousand men,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: That, for a fantasy and trick of fame,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Go to their graves like beds, fight for a plot
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Whereon the numbers cannot try the cause,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Which is not tomb enough and continent
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: To hide the slain? O, from this time forth,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: My thoughts be bloody, or be nothing worth!
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.speaker: Gentleman

lines.value: The hearers to collection; they aim at it,
lines.speaker: Gentleman

lines.value: I pray you.

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: All from her father's death. O Gertrude, Gertrude,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: When sorrows come, they come not single spies
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: But in battalions. First, her father slain:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Next, your son gone; and he most violent author
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Of his own just remove: the people muddied,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Thick and unwholesome in their thoughts and whispers,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: For good Polonius' death; and we have done but greenly,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: In hugger-mugger to inter him: poor Ophelia
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Divided from herself and her fair judgment,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Without the which we are pictures, or mere beasts:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Last, and as much containing as all these,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Her brother is in secret come from France;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Feeds on his wonder, keeps himself in clouds,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And wants not buzzers to infect his ear
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: With pestilent speeches of his father's death;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Wherein necessity, of matter beggar'd,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Nature is fine in love, and where 'tis fine,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: It sends some precious instance of itself
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: After the thing it loves.
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: And will he not come again?
lines.speaker: OPHELIA

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Laertes, I must commune with your grief,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Or you deny me right. Go but apart,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And they shall hear and judge 'twixt you and me:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: If by direct or by collateral hand
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: They find us touch'd, we will our kingdom give,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Our crown, our life, and all that we can ours,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To you in satisfaction; but if not,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Be you content to lend your patience to us,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And we shall jointly labour with your soul
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To give it due content.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: LAERTES
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Let this be so;
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: His means of death, his obscure funeral--
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: No trophy, sword, nor hatchment o'er his bones,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: No noble rite nor formal ostentation--
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Cry to be heard, as 'twere from heaven to earth,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: That I must call't in question.
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: So you shall;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And where the offence is let the great axe fall.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: I pray you, go with me.

lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: [Reads]  'Horatio, when thou shalt have overlooked
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: this, give these fellows some means to the king:
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: they have letters for him. Ere we were two days old
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: at sea, a pirate of very warlike appointment gave us
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: chase. Finding ourselves too slow of sail, we put on
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: a compelled valour, and in the grapple I boarded
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: them: on the instant they got clear of our ship; so
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: I alone became their prisoner. They have dealt with
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: me like thieves of mercy: but they knew what they
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: did; I am to do a good turn for them. Let the king
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: have the letters I have sent; and repair thou to me
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: with as much speed as thou wouldst fly death. I
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: have words to speak in thine ear will make thee
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: dumb; yet are they much too light for the bore of
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: the matter. These good fellows will bring thee
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: where I am. Rosencrantz and Guildenstern hold their
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: course for England: of them I have much to tell
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: thee. Farewell.
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: 'He that thou knowest thine, HAMLET.'
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Come, I will make you way for these your letters;
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: And do't the speedier, that you may direct me
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: To him from whom you brought them.

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And you must put me in your heart for friend,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Sith you have heard, and with a knowing ear,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That he which hath your noble father slain
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Pursued my life.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: LAERTES
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: It well appears: but tell me
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Why you proceeded not against these feats,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: So crimeful and so capital in nature,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: As by your safety, wisdom, all things else,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: You mainly were stirr'd up.
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: O, for two special reasons;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Which may to you, perhaps, seem much unsinew'd,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: But yet to me they are strong. The queen his mother
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Lives almost by his looks; and for myself--
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: My virtue or my plague, be it either which--
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: She's so conjunctive to my life and soul,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That, as the star moves not but in his sphere,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: I could not but by her. The other motive,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Why to a public count I might not go,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Is the great love the general gender bear him;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Who, dipping all his faults in their affection,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Would, like the spring that turneth wood to stone,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Convert his gyves to graces; so that my arrows,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Too slightly timber'd for so loud a wind,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Would have reverted to my bow again,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And not where I had aim'd them.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: LAERTES
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: And so have I a noble father lost;
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: A sister driven into desperate terms,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Whose worth, if praises may go back again,
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Stood challenger on mount of all the age
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: For her perfections: but my revenge will come.
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Break not your sleeps for that: you must not think
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That we are made of stuff so flat and dull
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That we can let our beard be shook with danger
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And think it pastime. You shortly shall hear more:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: I loved your father, and we love ourself;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And that, I hope, will teach you to imagine--
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: How now! what news?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Of the unworthiest siege.

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Than settled age his sables and his weeds,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Here was a gentleman of Normandy:--

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And they can well on horseback: but this gallant

lines.value: Had witchcraft in't; he grew unto his seat;

lines.value: With the brave beast: so far he topp'd my thought,

lines.value: That I, in forgery of shapes and tricks,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Come short of what he did.

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And gave you such a masterly report
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: For art and exercise in your defence
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That he cried out, 'twould be a sight indeed,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: If one could match you: the scrimers of their nation,

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Your sudden coming o'er, to play with him.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Now, out of this,--
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: LAERTES
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: What out of this, my lord?
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Laertes, was your father dear to you?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Or are you like the painting of a sorrow,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: A face without a heart?
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: LAERTES
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Why ask you this?
lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Not that I think you did not love your father;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: But that I know love is begun by time;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And that I see, in passages of proof,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Time qualifies the spark and fire of it.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: There lives within the very flame of love
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: A kind of wick or snuff that will abate it;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And nothing is at a like goodness still;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: For goodness, growing to a plurisy,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Dies in his own too much: that we would do
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: We should do when we would; for this 'would' changes
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And hath abatements and delays as many
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: As there are tongues, are hands, are accidents;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And then this 'should' is like a spendthrift sigh,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: That hurts by easing. But, to the quick o' the ulcer:--
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Hamlet comes back: what would you undertake,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: To show yourself your father's son in deed

lines.value: More than in words?

lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: To cut his throat i' the church.

lines.value: KING CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: No place, indeed, should murder sanctuarize;
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Revenge should have no bounds. But, good Laertes,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Will you do this, keep close within your chamber.
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Hamlet return'd shall know you are come home:
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: We'll put on those shall praise your excellence
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And set a double varnish on the fame
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: The Frenchman gave you, bring you in fine together
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: And wager on your heads: he, being remiss,

lines.value: Most generous and free from all contriving,
lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Will not peruse the foils; so that, with ease,

lines.speaker: KING CLAUDIUS

lines.value: I bought an unction of a mountebank,

lines.value: So mortal that, but dip a knife in it,

lines.value: Where it draws blood no cataplasm so rare,

lines.speaker: LAERTES

lines.value: Under the moon, can save the thing from death

lines.value: To the ambassadors of England gives
lines.speaker: OSRIC

lines.value: This warlike volley.
lines.speaker: OSRIC

lines.value: HAMLET
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: O, I die, Horatio;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: The potent poison quite o'er-crows my spirit:
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: I cannot live to hear the news from England;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: But I do prophesy the election lights
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: On Fortinbras: he has my dying voice;
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: So tell him, with the occurrents, more and less,
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: Which have solicited. The rest is silence.
lines.speaker: HAMLET

lines.value: HORATIO
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Now cracks a noble heart. Good night sweet prince:
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest!
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Why does the drum come hither?
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Where is this sight?
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: HORATIO
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: What is it ye would see?
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: If aught of woe or wonder, cease your search.
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: This quarry cries on havoc. O proud death,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: What feast is toward in thine eternal cell,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: That thou so many princes at a shot
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: So bloodily hast struck?
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: First Ambassador
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: The sight is dismal;
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: And our affairs from England come too late:
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: The ears are senseless that should give us hearing,
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: To tell him his commandment is fulfill'd,
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: That Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead:
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: Where should we have our thanks?
lines.speaker: First Ambassador

lines.value: HORATIO
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Not from his mouth,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Had it the ability of life to thank you:
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: He never gave commandment for their death.
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: But since, so jump upon this bloody question,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: You from the Polack wars, and you from England,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Are here arrived give order that these bodies
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: High on a stage be placed to the view;
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: And let me speak to the yet unknowing world
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: How these things came about: so shall you hear
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Of carnal, bloody, and unnatural acts,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Of accidental judgments, casual slaughters,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: And, in this upshot, purposes mistook
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Fall'n on the inventors' reads: all this can I
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Truly deliver.
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Let us haste to hear it,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: And call the noblest to the audience.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: For me, with sorrow I embrace my fortune:
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: I have some rights of memory in this kingdom,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Which now to claim my vantage doth invite me.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: HORATIO
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Of that I shall have also cause to speak,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: And from his mouth whose voice will draw on more;
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: But let this same be presently perform'd,
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: Even while men's minds are wild; lest more mischance
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: On plots and errors, happen.
lines.speaker: HORATIO

lines.value: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Let four captains
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Bear Hamlet, like a soldier, to the stage;
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: For he was likely, had he been put on,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: To have proved most royally: and, for his passage,
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: The soldiers' music and the rites of war
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Speak loudly for him.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Take up the bodies: such a sight as this
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Becomes the field, but here shows much amiss.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS

lines.value: Go, bid the soldiers shoot.
lines.speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
